One hundred kilometers from Seville, there is a small village, Marinaleda, that for the last thirty years has been at the center of a long struggle to create a communist utopia. In a story reminiscent of the Asterix books, Dan Hancox explores the reality behind the community where no one has a mortgage, sport is played in the Che Guevara stadium and there are monthly Ã¢â‚¬Å“Red SundaysÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ where everyone works together to clean up the neighbourhood. In particular he tells the story of the village mayor, SÃƒÂ¡nchez Gordillo, who in 2012 became a household name in Spain after leading raids on local supermarkets to feed the Andalucian unemployed.
